page.title: 01LANDSCAPE STROUD DISTRICT
page.content: Our area is situated in two valleys diverging from Stroud and on the plateau between the two valleys where Rodborough and Minchinhampton Commons are situated.In one valley,the A419 to Cirencester,we have the villages of Brimscombe and Thrupp and in the other valley, the A46 to Bath, we have the villages of Woodchester and Kingscourt with the fringes of Rodborough village to the North.The excellent vantage point of Rodborough Fort (rebuilt 1861) affords a panoramic view of the Severn Vale with a huge meander of the River Severn which has as a backcloth the beginnings of the Forest of Dean and beyond that the Black Mountains of Wales.The five Stroud valleys were full of cloth mills in the 17th century and many of the original buildings are used as factories today.
